Time of Day Routing is bound to Partitions.

A would seem to be the best answer here, unless this is supposed to be a "pick two", then it would be A and B

questions.question_text: An engineer is configuring a Cisco UCM solution. The requirements state that some users in one location will receive calls from a number during work hours 09AM to 5PM, and another group will get the calls from the same number outside this defined timeslot. Users will also change the outgoing number when reaching out to customers based on the same time-of-day routing rules. Which feature is needed to allow for this type of configuration?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B would make the most sense here

questions.question_text: A company is experiencing an issue where calls from the Cisco UCM via Cisco Unified Border Element to the ITSP fail with a “500 server internal error” right after a 183 session in progress is sent back from the ITSP. What must be enabled to resolve the issue?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
I have had to do this myself in the past. B is the answer.

Selected Answer: B
B would be the best answer here

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. An administrator received reports that users do not hear a ringback when they dial specific external numbers. For example, the Cisco Unified Border Element receives a delayed offer invite from Cisco UCM and responds with the 183 session progress in the exhibit. Assume that the PSTN is responsible for generating ringback in these problematic scenarios. Which action resolves the issue?

choices.D: Enable early media on the appropriate SIP trunk on Cisco UCM.
choices.A:
On Cisco Unified Border Element:
voice service voip
sip
rel1xx disable 100rel
choices.B: Edit the configuration for SIP Rel1XX Options in the appropriate SIP profile on Cisco UCM to Send PRACK if 1xx Contains SDP.
choices.C:
On Cisco Unified Border Element:
voice service voip
sip
rel1xx require 100rel

discussion.content: technically 'manager-fallback' covers SCCP phones which are out of scope CLACCM v1.2 blueprint

Selected Answer: BD
B and D are correct

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/cusrst/admin/sccp_sip_srst/configuration/guide/SCCP_and_SIP_SRST_Admin_Guide/srst_call_handling.html#ot5_zcs_r4b

questions.question_text: An SRST site must use pickup functionality on the Chicago remote site to allow the users to take incoming calls. The pickup command is configured under the call manager-fallback section on the SRST router. What are two results of that configuration? (Choose two.)

choices.D: Calls that come into one directory number can be picked up from another directory number.
choices.B: The PickUp soft key is on all SRST phones.
choices.E: Calls that come into a Cisco UCM registered phone can be picked up by a SRST phone.
choices.A: Calls that ring an unassigned directory number are forwarded to the auto-attendant.
choices.C: The GPickUp soft key is on all SRST phones.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
While the discussion on the provided page leans towards modifying the Diversion header, this approach does not address the modification of the Request-URI, which is essential for meeting the provider's requirements. Therefore, configuring a SIP profile to modify the Request-URI directly, as shown in Answer A, is the correct solution.

voice class sip-profiles 10 
request Invite sip-header Diversion modify “<sip:1(…)@” “<sip:9135551\1@” under the SIP profile configuration

Selected Answer: D

Selected Answer: D
The configurations are SIP Profile configurations. You have to look no further than the words SIP PROFILE to find the right answer....which is D.

comments.content: It's also the only answer with a valid syntax after testing on my CUBE

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D is the only answer that makes sense as SIP header modifications are done under voice-class sip-profiles config

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. Users report that outgoing calls do not work on the new SIP trunk for outgoing calls. The solution consists of a Cisco UCM Cluster linked to a Cisco Unified Border Element where the SIP trunk is terminated. The provider required 10 digits. The logs show a line going toward the Cisco Unified Border Element. Which code snippet must be added to the configuration to meet the requirement?

choices.B: request Invite sip-header modify “<sip:1(…)@” “<sip:9135551\1@” under the voice translation profile configuration
choices.A: request Invite sip-header modify “<sip:1(…)@” “<sip:9135551\1@” under the SIP translation profile configuration
choices.C: sip-header modify “<sip:1(…)@” “<sip:9135551\1@” under the voice translation profile configuration
choices.D: request Invite sip-header Diversion modify “<sip:1(…)@” “<sip:9135551\1@” under the SIP profile configuration
